faqs.question: What is GoalTracker AI?
faqs.answer: GoalTracker AI helps you set goals, track daily progress, and get AI-powered guidance to stay consistent and improve productivity.

faqs.question: How do I create an account?
faqs.answer: Click 'Login / Sign Up' in the header and switch to Sign Up. Enter your name, email, and password, then submit to create your account.

faqs.question: Can I browse without logging in?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can explore the dashboard and content without logging in. Actions that change data (e.g., creating or editing goals) will prompt a login modal.

faqs.question: Why do I see a login popup when I try to edit or create something?
faqs.answer: Editing, creating, or deleting data requires authentication. The app shows a login modal for unauthenticated users when they try restricted actions.

faqs.question: Is there a demo account I can use?
faqs.answer: Yes. Use Email: demo@example.com and Password: Demo123! to quickly explore the app without creating a new account.

faqs.question: How do I create a new goal?
faqs.answer: Go to the Goals page and click the add/create goal button. Fill in the goal details and save. If you are not logged in, you will be prompted to log in first.

faqs.question: How do I edit or delete a goal?
faqs.answer: On the Goals page, open a goal card and use the edit or delete actions. You must be logged in to make changes.

faqs.question: What goal details can I track?
faqs.answer: Each goal supports a title, category, notes, and completion status. You can also add daily logs to track progress over time.

faqs.question: How do I mark a goal as complete?
faqs.answer: Open the goal card and toggle the completion control. Completed goals are displayed accordingly in the dashboard.

faqs.question: How do daily logs work?
faqs.answer: Daily logs let you record what you did toward a goal each day. Visit the Today or Daily page to add or update your logs.

faqs.question: Can I add notes to daily logs or goals?
faqs.answer: Yes. Use the notes fields on goal cards or within daily logs to capture details, learnings, or blockers.

faqs.question: How do I use the AI Chat?
faqs.answer: Open the AI Chat page from the header, type your question, and press Send. The assistant will reply with helpful guidance.

faqs.question: What topics can the AI help with?
faqs.answer: The AI specializes in goals, habits, productivity, health, and related guidance. It may refuse unsupported topics based on policy.

faqs.question: I got 'Failed to get response from AI'. What should I do?
faqs.answer: Please try again in a few seconds. If the issue persists, check your internet connection or contact support. During development, verify your API key in .env.local.

faqs.question: Where is my data stored?
faqs.answer: Your account and app data are stored in Supabase. We use secure APIs to read and write your data.

faqs.question: Is my data secure?
faqs.answer: Yes. We use industry-standard security practices. Keep your credentials private and log out on shared devices.

faqs.question: The Questions page is empty. Why?
faqs.answer: If you see no results, it may mean there are no FAQs yet or your search/filter hides all items. Clear the search box and set category to 'All'.

faqs.question: The AI said my topic isn't supported. What does that mean?
faqs.answer: Some topics may be blocked by policy for safety reasons. Try asking about goals, habits, productivity, health, or related areas.

faqs.question: Where can I find the Questions page?
faqs.answer: Click 'Questions' in the header navigation or go to /questions.

faqs.question: Where is the AI Chat page?
faqs.answer: Use the 'AI Chat' link in the header or visit /chat.

faqs.question: How do I report a bug or request a feature?
faqs.answer: Please share steps to reproduce, screenshots if possible, and expected vs actual behavior. Contact the project maintainer or open an issue in your team workflow.

faqs.question: Are there any usage limits?
faqs.answer: Fair-use limits may apply to AI requests to ensure reliability. If you encounter rate limits, wait a bit and try again.

faqs.question: Which languages are supported?
faqs.answer: The interface and responses are optimized for English.

faqs.question: Which browsers are supported?
faqs.answer: Modern evergreen browsers (Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari) are supported. Keep your browser updated for the best experience.

faqs.question: How do I build a growth mindset?
faqs.answer: Start by embracing challenges, viewing setbacks as information, and praising effort over talent. Track small improvements daily and reflect on what you learned, not just outcomes.

faqs.question: How can I stay motivated on long-term goals?
faqs.answer: Break the goal into weekly milestones, celebrate micro-wins, and review your 'why' each morning. Keep your plan visible and commit to a consistent schedule, not just feelings.

faqs.question: What should I do when I feel stuck or procrastinating?
faqs.answer: Lower the activation energy: do a 2-minute starter task, set a 10-minute timer, and remove distractions. Once you begin, momentum will make the next step easier.

faqs.question: How do I bounce back after failure?
faqs.answer: Run a quick post-mortem: what worked, what didn’t, and what to try next. Reframe failure as feedback, set a small correction step, and restart within 24 hours.

faqs.question: How can I set motivating goals I actually care about?
faqs.answer: Use the 'why x3' test to connect goals to personal values. Make them specific, time-bound, and exciting, and write the first tiny action you’ll take today.

faqs.question: How do I create momentum when energy is low?
faqs.answer: Switch to a low-friction task, stand up, hydrate, and set a 5-minute focus sprint. Momentum often returns once you start and see progress.

faqs.question: How can I avoid burnout while staying driven?
faqs.answer: Use sustainable pacing: cap daily effort, schedule recovery blocks, and rotate task intensity. Protect sleep and keep one non-negotiable recharge habit.

faqs.question: Does positive self-talk really help? How do I start?
faqs.answer: Yes—language shapes focus. Replace harsh self-criticism with neutral prompts (e.g., 'What’s the next small step?') and keep a list of affirming statements near your workspace.

faqs.question: How can I keep going when results are slow?
faqs.answer: Switch your scoreboard to inputs over outcomes: sessions, minutes, or reps. Trust the lag—compound gains appear after consistency, not intensity.

faqs.question: What’s an effective morning routine to boost motivation?
faqs.answer: Keep it short: water, light movement, 5-minute planning, and one meaningful task before messages. Consistency beats elaborate routines.

faqs.question: How can I visualize success effectively?
faqs.answer: Visualize both the outcome and the process: see yourself handling obstacles calmly and executing key steps. Pair it with action—start immediately after visualizing.

faqs.question: How do I overcome fear of starting?
faqs.answer: Shrink the first step until it feels safe—often 5 minutes or less. Pre-commit a time and place, and remove one friction (tool, file, or tab) in advance.

faqs.question: How can I stay consistent without relying on motivation?
faqs.answer: Use implementation intentions (If X, then Y), stack behaviors onto existing habits, and track streaks weekly. Systems sustain you when motivation dips.

faqs.question: How do I deal with comparison and imposter syndrome?
faqs.answer: Compare to your past self, not others. Keep an evidence list of wins, ask for specific feedback, and remember progress > perfection.

faqs.question: How can I use accountability to stay motivated?
faqs.answer: Share weekly goals with a buddy or group, report results publicly, and schedule co-working sessions. Clear commitments increase follow-through.

faqs.question: How do I make small wins feel meaningful?
faqs.answer: Journal one sentence about progress and what enabled it. Reward consistency with a tiny celebration to reinforce the identity you want.

faqs.question: How can I cultivate daily discipline?
faqs.answer: Decide once: set fixed start times, remove choices, and use checklists. Discipline is easier when you reduce decisions and automate first steps.

faqs.question: Can environment or music boost motivation?
faqs.answer: Yes. Prime your space with a clean desk, single-task setup, and a 'start' playlist. Environmental cues reduce friction and trigger focus.

faqs.question: How do I reframe negative thoughts quickly?
faqs.answer: Use the 'evidence and alternative' test: What evidence supports this thought? What’s an equally realistic alternative? Practice neutral, action-oriented phrasing.

faqs.question: What’s a quick 5-minute mindset reset?
faqs.answer: Stand up, breathe 4-7-8, write one next step, set a 5-minute timer, and begin. Action creates clarity and restarts momentum.

faqs.question: What’s the best beginner workout plan?
faqs.answer: Start with 3 days/week full-body: push, pull, legs, plus 20 minutes brisk walking on off days. Focus on form and progressive overload.

faqs.question: How many steps per day should I aim for?
faqs.answer: 7,000–10,000 steps/day is a practical target for general health; pick a baseline now and add 1,000 steps every 1–2 weeks.

faqs.question: Is cardio or strength training better for fat loss?
faqs.answer: Both help, but strength preserves muscle while a calorie deficit drives fat loss. Combine 2–3 strength sessions with 2 light cardio days.

faqs.question: How much protein do I need?
faqs.answer: Aim for ~1.6–2.2 g/kg of body weight daily, spread across meals. Prioritize lean sources and include protein at breakfast.

faqs.question: What’s an easy way to improve diet quality?
faqs.answer: Use the plate method: half vegetables, quarter protein, quarter smart carbs, plus healthy fats. Plan 1–2 nutritious staples per meal.

faqs.question: How much sleep is ideal for fitness and health?
faqs.answer: 7–9 hours/night for most adults. Keep consistent sleep/wake times, limit late caffeine, and wind down 30–60 minutes before bed.

faqs.question: How do I stay consistent with workouts?
faqs.answer: Schedule fixed days/times, keep sessions short (30–45 min), and prepare your gear the night before. Track workouts to see progress.

faqs.question: What’s a simple warm-up routine?
faqs.answer: 5 minutes light cardio, then dynamic moves for the joints you’ll train (e.g., hip hinges, arm circles, bodyweight squats). Avoid static stretching pre-lift.

faqs.question: How can I prevent workout injuries?
faqs.answer: Progress gradually, use proper form, and listen to early pain signals. Build mobility and take deload weeks every 6–8 weeks.

faqs.question: Do I need supplements?
faqs.answer: Food first. Consider protein powder, creatine monohydrate, and vitamin D if deficient; consult a professional before adding others.

faqs.question: How do I start strength training at home?
faqs.answer: Use bodyweight moves (squats, push-ups, rows, hip hinges) 3 days/week. Add bands or dumbbells as you progress.

faqs.question: What’s a balanced weekly training split?
faqs.answer: 2–3 full-body strength days, 1–2 cardio days, and daily walking. Keep 1–2 rest or active recovery days.

faqs.question: How important is hydration?
faqs.answer: Very. Aim for pale-yellow urine and sip water regularly. Add electrolytes for long or sweaty sessions.

faqs.question: What’s a good post-workout meal?
faqs.answer: Include protein (20–40g) and carbs to refuel, plus fluids. Whole foods like yogurt + fruit or rice + chicken work well.

faqs.question: Can I lose fat and gain muscle at the same time?
faqs.answer: It’s possible for beginners or with higher body fat. Focus on protein, strength training, sleep, and a slight calorie deficit.

faqs.question: How do I make healthy eating easier?
faqs.answer: Meal-prep basics: cook proteins in bulk, pre-chop vegetables, and keep simple staples ready. Default to a few go-to meals.

faqs.question: What’s NEAT and why does it matter?
faqs.answer: NEAT is non-exercise activity (walking, chores, fidgeting). It significantly impacts daily calorie burn—stand up and move often.

faqs.question: How do I manage cravings?
faqs.answer: Don’t fight them head-on; add protein and fiber at meals, reduce trigger foods in sight, and use 10-minute pause tactics before snacks.

faqs.question: What’s a quick hotel room workout?
faqs.answer: Circuit 3x: 12 squats, 8–12 push-ups, 12 glute bridges, 20-second plank, 30 seconds fast step-ups or jumping jacks. Rest 60–90 seconds.

faqs.question: How can I keep joints healthy while training?
faqs.answer: Use full ranges of motion, include mobility drills, and progress loads gradually. If pain persists, deload and consult a professional.

faqs.question: What’s the simplest way to plan my day?
faqs.answer: Pick 3 Most Important Tasks (MITs), time-block them on your calendar, and group small admin tasks into a single 30–45 minute block.

faqs.question: How does the Pomodoro technique help focus?
faqs.answer: Work 25 minutes fully focused, then rest 5. After 3–4 cycles, take a longer break. Use it to overcome inertia and reduce burnout.

faqs.question: How do I prioritize tasks effectively?
faqs.answer: Use the Eisenhower Matrix: do important-urgent now, schedule important-not-urgent, delegate non-important-urgent, and delete non-important-not-urgent.

faqs.question: How can I reduce context switching?
faqs.answer: Batch similar tasks (email, calls, design), turn off notifications during deep work, and keep one 'in-progress' task at a time.

faqs.question: What is deep work and how do I start?
faqs.answer: Deep work is distraction-free focus on cognitively demanding tasks. Book 60–120 minute blocks, clear your desk, and set a specific outcome.

faqs.question: How do I handle interruptions at work?
faqs.answer: Use a visible focus signal, park new requests in a capture list, and schedule quick 'office hours' to batch reactive tasks.

faqs.question: What’s a smarter way to manage email?
faqs.answer: Check in 2–3 windows per day, use filters and templates, archive aggressively, and convert action emails to tasks with due dates.

faqs.question: How can I reduce meeting overload?
faqs.answer: Create no-meeting blocks, require an agenda with outcomes, end at 25/50 minutes, and replace status meetings with async updates.

faqs.question: Time blocking vs. to-do lists—which is better?
faqs.answer: Combine them: plan tasks on a to-do list, then allocate calendar blocks for the highest-impact items. Protect those blocks.

faqs.question: When should I use checklists vs. projects?
faqs.answer: Use checklists for recurring processes (QA, publishing). Use projects for multi-step outcomes with a clear done definition and deadline.

faqs.question: What’s a strong way to start the day?
faqs.answer: Plan the night before, protect your first deep-work block, and finish one MIT before opening messages.

faqs.question: How do I track time to improve productivity?
faqs.answer: Run a 1–2 week time audit with categories (deep work, meetings, admin). Identify leaks and re-block your calendar accordingly.

faqs.question: How can I overcome perfectionism slowing me down?
faqs.answer: Define a Minimum Viable Output (MVO), set a time cap, and iterate later. Perfection is a process, not a starting point.

faqs.question: How do I prevent my calendar from getting overloaded?
faqs.answer: Apply the 60% rule (leave buffer), batch meetings, and include transition time. Decline or delegate low-value invites.

faqs.question: What’s a reliable capture system?
faqs.answer: Use a single trusted inbox (notes app or task manager), capture everything quickly, and process to projects or next actions daily.

faqs.question: What should a weekly review include?
faqs.answer: Clear inboxes, review projects, plan next week’s MITs, and block deep-work sessions. Celebrate wins and adjust priorities.

faqs.question: How do I manage deadlines without last-minute rushes?
faqs.answer: Work backward from the due date, set interim milestones, and front-load risk. Send progress updates before anyone asks.

faqs.question: How can I estimate task durations better?
faqs.answer: Use reference class forecasting (past similar tasks), double your initial guess, and add a 20–50% buffer for uncertainty.

faqs.question: How do I align work with my energy levels?
faqs.answer: Schedule creative or analytical work during your peak hours and place admin tasks during lows. Protect peaks with focus blocks.

faqs.question: What tools should I use without overcomplicating?
faqs.answer: Pick one task manager, one calendar, and one notes app—sync across devices. Simplicity and consistency beat tool-hopping.

faqs.question: How do I start a habit that actually sticks?
faqs.answer: Make it tiny (2 minutes), tie it to a reliable cue, and track a weekly streak. Focus on identity: ‘I’m the kind of person who…’.

faqs.question: What is the 2-minute rule?
faqs.answer: Shrink the first step to under 2 minutes so starting is easy. Starting often creates momentum to continue.

faqs.question: How does habit stacking work?
faqs.answer: Attach a new behavior to an existing habit: ‘After I [current habit], I will [new tiny action]’. The cue triggers the routine.

faqs.question: How do I design my environment for discipline?
faqs.answer: Make good habits obvious and easy (lay gear out), and bad habits invisible and hard (remove triggers, add friction).

faqs.question: What are keystone habits?
faqs.answer: High-leverage behaviors that create cascading benefits (sleep, exercise, planning). Start with 1–2 to maximize momentum.

faqs.question: How do I recover after missing a day?
faqs.answer: Never miss twice. Schedule the next session immediately and return to your minimum viable version to rebuild momentum.

faqs.question: How do I break a bad habit?
faqs.answer: Identify the trigger, replace the routine, change the environment, and increase friction. Pair with an alternative reward.

faqs.question: Motivation vs discipline—what’s the difference?
faqs.answer: Motivation is a feeling; discipline is a system. Rely on cues, schedules, and checklists—feelings are optional.

faqs.question: What is an implementation intention?
faqs.answer: An if–then plan: ‘If [cue], then I will [action]’. It boosts follow-through by pre-deciding your response.

faqs.question: How do commitment devices help?
faqs.answer: Add stakes or constraints (lock apps, public commitments, deposits) to make the desired action easier than the alternative.

faqs.question: What’s the best way to track habits?
faqs.answer: Use a simple checklist or calendar chain. Review weekly, not perfectly daily, to focus on trends over perfection.

faqs.question: How big should habit increments be?
faqs.answer: Increase by 5–10% per week and deload every 4–6 weeks. Keep jumps small to avoid burnout and injury.

faqs.question: How do I keep habits on weekends or travel?
faqs.answer: Create a travel variant (short, equipment-free). Keep the streak alive with a minimum viable version.

faqs.question: How long does it take to form a habit?
faqs.answer: Commonly 4–12 weeks. Focus on reps and cues, not a fixed number of days. Consistency builds automaticity.

faqs.question: Morning vs evening habits—what’s better?
faqs.answer: Choose the time that matches your energy and context. The consistent cue matters more than the clock.

faqs.question: How can I avoid decision fatigue?
faqs.answer: Decide once: pre-plan menus, outfit, or workout. Use checklists and templates to reduce daily choices.

faqs.question: What’s temptation bundling?
faqs.answer: Pair a habit you need with something you enjoy (podcast while walking). It boosts motivation without willpower.

faqs.question: How do I set realistic habit goals?
faqs.answer: Define a nonzero minimum and a clear ‘done’ definition. Raise the ceiling after 2–3 easy weeks.

faqs.question: How do rewards affect habits?
faqs.answer: Immediate, small, and intrinsic rewards reinforce behavior. Track progress where you can see it.

faqs.question: How do I sustain discipline when stressed?
faqs.answer: Shrink to minimums, protect sleep, and schedule recovery. Keep systems simple and visible.

faqs.question: How can I build daily self-awareness?
faqs.answer: Do a 2-minute check-in: What am I feeling? Why? What do I need? Name it to tame it.

faqs.question: What is emotional labeling?
faqs.answer: Putting feelings into words reduces intensity and improves control. Use specific emotion words.

faqs.question: How do I pause before reacting?
faqs.answer: Use a 4-7-8 breath or count to ten. The 90-second rule lets emotional chemicals settle before you respond.

faqs.question: How do I reframe unhelpful thoughts?
faqs.answer: Practice cognitive reappraisal: find alternative interpretations and focus on controllables and next steps.

faqs.question: How do I listen actively?
faqs.answer: Paraphrase what you heard, ask open questions, and resist the urge to fix. Aim to understand first.

faqs.question: How can I build empathy?
faqs.answer: Use perspective-taking and curiosity. Ask, ‘What matters most to you right now?’ and reflect feelings back.

faqs.question: What framework helps with hard conversations?
faqs.answer: Try Nonviolent Communication: observations, feelings, needs, and clear requests.

faqs.question: How do I give feedback well?
faqs.answer: Use SBI: Situation, Behavior, Impact. Ask permission, be specific, and suggest next steps.

faqs.question: How do I receive feedback gracefully?
faqs.answer: Listen fully, ask clarifying questions, thank them, and choose one change to apply. Separate intent from impact.

faqs.question: How do I map emotional triggers?
faqs.answer: Keep a trigger journal: note situation, thought, feeling, action. Spot patterns and plan if–then responses.

faqs.question: What are healthy boundaries?
faqs.answer: Clear limits that protect your energy and values. Say no early, explain briefly, and offer alternatives when possible.

faqs.question: How do I apologize effectively?
faqs.answer: Acknowledge impact, take responsibility without excuses, and make a specific repair or next step.

faqs.question: What are quick ways to regulate stress?
faqs.answer: Slow breathing, progressive muscle relaxation, and a short walk. Pair with a calming reframe.

faqs.question: What is emotional granularity?
faqs.answer: Using specific emotion words (irritated vs angry). Greater granularity improves regulation and communication.

faqs.question: How do I handle criticism constructively?
faqs.answer: Extract the signal from the tone, ask for examples, and set boundaries if it turns abusive. Decide one improvement.

faqs.question: How can I cultivate gratitude?
faqs.answer: Write three good things daily and note who to thank. Gratitude broadens attention and buffers stress.

faqs.question: How do I manage conflict at work?
faqs.answer: Define the problem, surface interests, brainstorm options, and agree on a small next step. Follow up.

faqs.question: How do I build social awareness?
faqs.answer: Watch body language, tone, and context. Check assumptions and ask clarifying questions.

faqs.question: How can I self-soothe in the moment?
faqs.answer: Breathe slowly, use 5-4-3-2-1 grounding, and label feelings. Shift posture to signal safety.

faqs.question: How do I de-escalate tense situations?
faqs.answer: Lower your voice, validate the other person’s feelings, and propose a small, concrete next step.
